properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 4 at 10:09AM PST until February 5 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...Active Winter Weather Returns to the Area...

.A Pacific storm system will bring snow to all elevations of the
region beginning Tuesday afternoon and continuing into Wednesday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7
inches in the valleys and 8 to 12 inches in the mountains.

* WHERE...Kellogg, Pinehurst, Osburn, Wallace, Mullan, Fourth of
July Pass, Dobson Pass, and Lookout Pass.

* WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 6 PM PST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult tonight and Wednesday
morning.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will begin late this afternoon
and increase in intensity after midnight.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM PST WEDNESDAY
